dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2019, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority just issued an initial enforcement order against Amazon and Deliveroo.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty nineteen, the U K's Competition and Markets Authority just issued an initial enforcement order against Amazon and Deliveroo.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, over that $580 million funding round Amazon led in June. They're worried the two companies might not be distinct anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, over that five hundred eighty dollars million funding round Amazon led in June. They're worried the two companies might not be distinct anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because Amazon's only a minority shareholder, right? Deliveroo was last valued at, um, $2.1 billion back in 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because Amazon's only a minority shareholder, right? Deliveroo was last valued at, um, two point one dollars billion back in twenty seventeen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo, which was last valued at $2 billion in 2017 when it raised a $482 million round.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But the CMA says they have reasonable grounds to believe they're no longer separate entities—though they didn't specify what those are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But the C M A says they have reasonable grounds to believe they're no longer separate entities-though they didn't specify what those are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, the CMA said it has reasonable grounds to believe the two companies are no longer distinct. It declined to specify what these reasonable grounds are, but theyre likely based on public information about the deal, as well as information it has received privately from Amazon and Deliveroo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're also concerned about a potential future merger. Like, imagine ordering Deliveroo through Alexa or something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're also concerned about a potential future merger. Like, imagine ordering Deliveroo through Alexa or something.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CMA said it is also concerned that the two companies could merge at some point in the future. Closer cooperation between the two companies could see Deliveroo customers placing orders via Amazon Alexa, or a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh for sure. Amazon already tried and failed with its own food delivery service, Amazon Restaurants, which it scrapped in July.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh for sure. Amazon already tried and failed with its own food delivery service, Amazon Restaurants, which it scrapped in July.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Closer cooperation between the two companies could see Deliveroo customers placing orders via Amazon Alexa, or a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So this is kind of their second shot at the market. But regulators are really clamping down on big tech these days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this is kind of their second shot at the market. But regulators are really clamping down on big tech these days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, European regulators are clamping down on U.S. tech giants over allegedly monopolistic and uncompetitive tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like that Google Shopping fine from the European Commission. And shares of other delivery firms like JustEat and Delivery Hero dropped when the Amazon-Deliveroo deal was announced.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like that Google Shopping fine from the European Commission. And shares of other delivery firms like JustEat and Delivery Hero dropped when the Amazon-Deliveroo deal was announced.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, Google was fine recently by the European Commission for promoting its own Google Shopping service in its search results ahead of other retailers. When Amazon announced that it planned to invest in Deliveroo, shares in takeaway firms across Europesuch as JustEat, Takeaway.com, and Delivery Herotumbled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The enforcement order basically pauses everything while they decide if they need a Phase 1 investigation—that'd last 40 days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The enforcement order basically pauses everything while they decide if they need a Phase one investigation-that'd last forty days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokeswoman for the CMA told Forbes that the initial enforcement order (IEO) has been issued to effectively pause the deal between Amazon and Deliveroo while it decides whether it needs to complete what is known as a Phase 1 investigation, which would last for 40 days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And if that happens, it's a strong signal they're taking this seriously. But Deliveroo says this investment actually boosts competition and creates jobs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if that happens, it's a strong signal they're taking this seriously. But Deliveroo says this investment actually boosts competition and creates jobs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The fact that the IEO has been issued is a strong indication that a Phase 1 investigation will be carried out, she said. This investment will help create jobs, help restaurants to grow their businesses and will improve choice for consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Though some argue that if Deliveroo didn't get this funding, they might go out of business—which would be worse for consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though some argue that if Deliveroo didn't get this funding, they might go out of business-which would be worse for consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Deliveroo failed to raise the money from Amazon, and it went out of business as a result, then it could be argued that it would be a worse outcome for consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True. And Jonathan Branton from DWF pointed out that minority stake investigations are less common, but not unheard of.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. And Jonathan Branton from D W F pointed out that minority stake investigations are less common, but not unheard of.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jonathan Branton, head of EU competition at DWF, said: Investigations into acquisitions of minority stakes are certainly less common than they are for standard acquisitions, but that is not to say they do not happen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So if the deal is blocked, Deliveroo would have to go back to the drawing board for investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So if the deal is blocked, Deliveroo would have to go back to the drawing board for investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, if the deal is blocked, then Deliveroo would have to go back to the drawing board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But Erin Platts from Silicon Valley Bank thinks they could find other backers if needed. Still, it's a tricky situation for both companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Erin Platts from Silicon Valley Bank thinks they could find other backers if needed. Still, it's a tricky situation for both companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Erin Platts, head of Silicon Valley Bank in EMEA, told Forbes that Deliveroo wouldnt have too much difficulty finding other investors if the CMA prevented it from accepting money from Amazon.
